weather_report:
The atmosphere enveloping Downtown San Francisco this afternoon is one of gray and moody anticipation, the clouds heavy with the promise of rain. The temperature rests achingly close to fifty-nine degrees, while a brisk south wind whistles through, carrying with it the scent of the ocean and the soft resonance of distant thunder. The forecast, confident in its prediction, tells us we can expect rain to fall steadily; a gentle but persistent curtain that will draw the day to a close, while the sky hangs thick and brooding above.

As the evening deepens, temperatures will linger at a comfortable fifty-six, though the winds will continue to howl, gusting upwards of forty-four miles per hour. A time like this feels best suited for moments spent indoors, wrapped in the warmth of a cozy sweater and perhaps sipping on a mug of your favorite warm beverage. If you must venture out, an umbrella is essential — ideally sturdy enough to withstand the gusts, serving not just as protection from the rain but as a shield against the chill that seeps into the bones. One might find solace in a quiet café, watching the rain's rhythmic dance against the window or curling up with a good book, enjoying the pleasure of being tucked away from the elements. For those who crave adventure, a brisk walk through the neighborhood may yield the atmospheric beauty of rain-soaked streets, the city’s iconic landmarks shrouded in a veil of mist, echoing the timeless allure of San Francisco—even in the gloom.
